In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's a function `wrap_string` in Julia that takes a string and wraps it at a specified `text_width`:
```julia
function wrap_string(str::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(str)
    wrapped_str = ""
    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) <= text_width
            current_line *= word * " "
        else
            wrapped_str *= current_line * "\n"
            current_line = word * " "
        end
    end
    wrapped_str *= current_line
    return wrapped_str
end
```

Here's an example of how you can use the function:
```julia
julia> str = "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog"
"The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog"

julia> wrapped_str = wrap_string(str, 15)
"The quick brown fox\njumps over the lazy\ndog
